result.execSummary:
The defendant Shamar D Burks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Shamar D Burks is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Shamar D Burks was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Shamar D Burks in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called with 21CM1218. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter.
Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.
AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant changes his/her plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his/her plea, advised of his/her Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his/her rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions/elements and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
AS TO COUNTS 2 & 3:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered counts dismissed.

Sentencing hearing proceeded on this case and on 21CM1218.  Statements from state, defense and defendant.
The Court ordered the Defendant to:
As to 22CM453
- Serve 60 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, straight time.
As to 21CM1218
- Serve 60 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence and consecutive to 22CM453, with credit for 4 days time served.
Court stayed the sentences and placed defendant on 12 months probation.
Conditions of probation are:
- 30 days condition in the HOC straight time as to case 22CM453. Condition time is imposed and stayed by use of the PO Agent.
- maintain work and school
- absolute sobriety with random testing
- no possesion of weapons/firearms
- 15 hours of community service as to case 21CM1218.
- no contact with SYS
- participate in a cognitive intervention program
- write a 2-page essay as to case 22CM453

Court set restitution at zero.
Court ordered defendant provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharges.

All costs, surcharges and assessment (including the DNA surcharges) to be paid by the end of probation to convert to a civil judgment.

Appeal rights given.

Court denied defense motion for expungement.

Defendant Shamar D Burks in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Shamar D Burks appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Hearing held via zoom/DAcast.  Defense counsel has received discovery and will receive a global offer and requests additional time to review.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription and no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with S.Y.S.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Shamar D Burks in court with attorney Amanda Poznanski.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Shamar D Burks not in court.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 2/28/22 @ 1p
